gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕੇਲਾ ਬਸਤ ਬਬੂਰ ਕੈ ਨਿਕਟ ਤਾਂਹਿ ਸਾਲਤ ਹੈਂ ਸੂਰੈਂ ਅਾਪਾ ਸਕੈ ਨ ਬਚਾੲਿ ਜੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Kaylaa Basat Baboor Kai Nikat Taanhi , Saalat Hain Soorain Aapaa Sakai N Bachaai Jee ?
translation: Just as leaves of a plaintain tree are torn by the thorns of an acacia tree growing within its proximity, it can not free itself from the hold of the thorns without damaging itself.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਪਿੰਜਰੀ ਮੈ ਸੂਅਾ ਪੜਤ ਗਾਥਾ ਅਨੇਕ ਦਿਨਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਹੇਰਤਿ ਬਿਲਾੲੀ ਅੰਤਿ ਖਾੲਿ ਜੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Pinjaree Mai Sooaa Parhat Gaadaa Anayka , Dinaprati Hayrati Bilaaee Anti Khaai Jee ?
translation: Just as a parrot in a small cage learns much but he is watched by a cat who one day catches it and eats it up.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਅੰਤਰ ਮੁਦਤ ਮਨ ਹੋਤ ਮੀਨ ਮਾਸ ਲਪਟਾੲਿ ਲੇਤ ਬਨਛੀ ਲਗਾੲਿ ਜੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Jal Antar Mudat Man Hot Meena , Maas Lapataai Layt Banachhee Lagaai Jee ?
translation: Just as a fish feels happy living in water but an angler throws the bait tied at the end of a strong thread and the fish is enticed to eat it. When the fish bites the bait, it bites the hook as well making it convenient for the angler to pull it out.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਾਧ ਮਿਲਤ ਅਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਿ ਅੰਗ ਅੰਗ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਪ੍ਰਗਟਾੲਿ ਜੀ ||੬੩੪||
transliteration: Bin Satigur Saadh Milat Asaadh Sangi , Ang Ang Duramati Gati Pragataai Jee ?634?
translation: Similarly, without meeting the God-like True Guru, and keeping company of base people, one acquires base wisdom that becomes the cause of his falling in the hands of angels of death.  (634)
